location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:155 x 205 mmFormat:1 b&w silver gelatin printCondition:The image is in good condition with minimal fading.Process:Gelatin silver print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This aerial view of Khor Jarama (Jarameh) a lagoon near Ra’s al Ḩadd was taken on 4 February 1932 by the R.A.F. during a reconnaissance mission in advance of a planned bombardment of Aiqa and Jaalan (Ja‘alān) described in following folios, f. 129-130.The foreground and middle-ground are taken up by the lagoon while a spit of land is visible in the background.The inscriptions in the upper right corner probably refer to camera settings, as well as date and time of capture.Inscriptions:Recto, directly into negative, upper right corner: 203.B.362.P KHOR-JARAMA LOOKING N. 4.2.32.1520 F6" 1000'’Verso, ink stamp: 'ROYAL AIR FORCE OFFICIAL CROWN COPYRIGHT RESERVED U203 Date 18/2/32'; 'FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY'Temporal Context:Prints produced on 18 February 1932. Photographs taken on 4 February 1932, likely at 3.20 pm.
